Rodney De Luna 
178  Landing Ln New Braunfels, TX 78130 (210)438-2483 rodney.deluna6@aol.com 
 
Professional Summary 
Experienced and accomplished professional with 15 years of health care back ground.  I have worked in 
various sectors of the health care industry starting as a Pharmacy Technician in retail, mail order and 
hospital setting and transitioned to a Manage Care Organization setting as a member services benefits 
representative and currently as a Configuration Specialist, QNXT SME (Provider Conversion and 
Implementation)/Management trainer.  I am capable of managing, preforming, analyzing and 
conducting audits of multiple data sets within various user systems.  Perform data analysis using report 
management tools in addition to routine monthly state reporting.  I have conducted contract analysis, 
configured and built in an automation pricing environment. I am qualified to work with system

management tools in addition to routine monthly state reporting.  I have conducted contract analysis, 
configured and built in an automation pricing environment. I am qualified to work with system 
conversion in correspondence with provider conversion, implementation and design.  I am able to 
conduct and interact with all levels of management, staff, and departments within the organization. As 
well as outsource entities/consultant groups/consultants and various support agencies, organized 
meetings with in daily functions. I am a goal driven professional looking to pursue growth in higher level 
responsibilities in fields of analyzing, reporting, data management while applying my strong skill sets of 
organization, leadership, educator, and communication for professional and personal success. I have 
created various procedures in my career thought out my tenure with organizations to increase cost

organization, leadership, educator, and communication for professional and personal success. I have 
created various procedures in my career thought out my tenure with organizations to increase cost 
efficiency, produce productivity, eliminate waste, and optimize work flow.  My ability to adapt, train, 
mentor and lead as a professional has given myself the advantage to work in various working 
environments while advancing in a positive way.

  QNXT Provider Data Management SME Lead: 
o Reconfigured/re-designed provider data from legacy system to QNXT core system. 
o Troubleshoot and guided provider functionality to accommodate provider set up and 
regulations.

o Developed and UAT of interfaces between Utilization Management “Jiva”, monthly 
Provider Directory, and credentialing  regulatory state reporting deliverables  pulled out 
of QNXT.

o QA Analyst for QNXT Conversion.

o Outlined and documented business needs and requirements. 
o Analyzed and prepared provider data to convert into QNXT. Consisted of over 15,000 In-
Plan Providers and 5,000 Non- Par Providers. 
o Configured provider set up for RHCs and FQHC provider groups. 
o Developed new department SOP, Policies, and desk level procedures. 
o Developed work flow procedures in relation t with various departments: Member 
services, UM, Claims, credentialing and Network Management.  
o Developed training manual for data management with regards to provider set up,

services, UM, Claims, credentialing and Network Management.  
o Developed training manual for data management with regards to provider set up, 
changes, call tracking, claims workflow and internal business requirements.

Claims, UM, upper Management on QNXT core systems functionality, provider step up 
and modules. 
o

o Worked directly with IS team and consultants to conduct migration of provider data 
within various matrix templates.  
o UAT of claims work flow in relation to provider data and edit 101. 
o UAT of 837  in regards to provider mapping with QNXT core system. 
o Ensure quality control and assurance of data conversion into QNXT.
